memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int conformer_num, unsigned int retryPerConformer, Protein *protein, Molecule *ligand, Score::ScoringFunctionType scFuncType, Heuristics::GlobalHeuristicType heurType, Optimizer::LocalOptimizerType localOptimizerType_, unsigned int seed)
memberdef.name: ConformerRigidDockingEngine

briefdescription.para: Set the protein domain/box to consider for docking.

detaileddescription.para: A restriction of the search space can be necessary : this provides a way to specify a domain/box in the protein where the docking will take place.

simplesect.para: Returns whether it has been successful

detaileddescription.para: Prepare the engine for docking. It is expected in future versions to separate protein, ligand, and prot-ligand initilization, so as to allow maximum work sharing in screening scenario (same prot = same prot prep, just different ligand)

simplesect.para: Returns whether it has been successful
Returns whether it has been successful

detaileddescription.para: Behaviour is undefined if called before runDockingEngine()

briefdescription.para: Generates a lot of conformer, then runs rigid docking on them.

detaileddescription.para: The general idea is generating lots of conformer, then docking them with constant bond angle and distance ("rigid" docking). The theory being that this may be faster than real docking and still produce a similar affinity ranking. (In practice, I do not know if it would work : hence this to try it

node.label: std::vector< std::tuple< std::shared_ptr< SmolDock::Bond >, unsigned int, unsigned int, std::vector< unsigned int > > >

childnode.edgelabel: < std::tuple< std::shared_ptr< SmolDock::Bond >, unsigned int, unsigned int, std::vector< unsigned int > > >

node.label: std::map< unsigned int, std::tuple< unsigned long, unsigned long > >

childnode.edgelabel: < unsigned int, std::tuple< unsigned long, unsigned long > >
